abstract_summ: To assess the effect of early travel restrictions adopted by the health authorities in China, we have implemented an epidemic metapopulation model that is fed with mobility data corresponding to 2019 and 2020.To assess the effect of early travel restrictions adopted by the health authorities in China, we have implemented an epidemic metapopulation model that is fed with mobility data corresponding to 2019 and 2020.This study shows that COVID-19 spread and fatality tend to be high across the world but compared to tropical countries, it is going to be incredibly high in the temperate countries having lower temperature (7-16°C) and humidity (80-90%) in last March.However, Malaysia and Singapore and the neighboring tropical countries of China got relatively low spread and fatality that created a research interest on whether there are potential impacts of weather condition on COVID-19 spread.We developed an alternative geo-stratified debiasing estimation framework by incorporating human mobility with case reporting data in three stratified zones, i.e., Wuhan, Hubei Province excluding Wuhan, and mainland China excluding Hubei.
title_summ: Incorporating Human Movement Data to Improve Epidemiological Estimates for 2019-nCoVPredict the next moves of COVID-19: reveal the temperate and tropical countries scenarioA data-driven assessment of early travel restrictions related to the spreading of the novel COVID-19 within mainland ChinaCan Search Query Forecast successfully in China's 2019-nCov pneumonia?A data-driven assessment of early travel restrictions related to the spreading of the novel COVID-19 within mainland China
title_abstract_phrases: To assess the effect of early travel restrictions adopted by the health authorities in China, we have implemented an epidemic metapopulation model that is fed with mobility data corresponding to 2019 and 2020.To assess the effect of early travel restrictions adopted by the health authorities in China, we have implemented an epidemic metapopulation model that is fed with mobility data corresponding to 2019 and 2020.A data-driven assessment of early travel restrictions related to the spreading of the novel COVID-19 within mainland ChinaTwo months after it was firstly reported, the novel coronavirus disease COVID-19 has already spread worldwide.A data-driven assessment of early travel restrictions related to the spreading of the novel COVID-19 within mainland ChinaTwo months after it was firstly reported, the novel coronavirus disease COVID-19 spread worldwide.Incorporating Human Movement Data to Improve Epidemiological Estimates for 2019-nCoVEstimating the key epidemiological features of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) epidemic proves to be challenging, given incompleteness and delays in early data reporting, in particular, the severe under-reporting bias in the epicenter, Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
